info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 12 at 7:11AM CDT until June 12 at 10:00AM CDT by NWS Austin/San Antonio TX
info.description:
* WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of south central Texas, including the following counties, Bandera and Medina.
* WHEN...Until 1000 AM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. River or stream flows are elevated.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 710 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen over the past several hours. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch is possible over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hondo, Castroville, New Fountain, Quihi, Dunlay, Mico, Bader, Hill Country State Natural Area, Lakehills, Rio Medina, D'Hanis, Cliff, Government Canyon State Natural Area and Lake Medina Shores. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM CDT THIS MORNING... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING
